product.title: Putt Two Par: How To Master Distance Control When Putting
product.categories_flat: All Departments > Books > Reference > Encyclopedias & Subject Guides
product.book_description: Do You Struggle with Distance Control When Putting?Are You Tired of 3 Putting?McDonald’s Founder Ray Kroc was asked what it felt like to be an Overnight Success. His answer was profound: “I was an Overnight Success all right, but 30 Years is a long, long night.”. My Long, Long Night is 37 years in the making, but this is a Simple Decision for YOURSELF.. Purchase this book, and if by chance you don’t like to read, go Directly to the 5 Drills that were designed and created around my Method and YOU WILL Lower Your Putting Stroke Average.. The putting subjects covered in this book are Distance Control (The first step towards becoming a Master Putter), Grip & Alignment, Ball Position, my Body-Part to Body-Part Technique (designed to develop a smooth physical putting stroke), and a complete INNOVATIVE, Simplified, Revision on how to Read Greens based on my Putting Method.. From a Pure Beginner/Novice Golfer to the Tour Pro Putt Two Par will Teach YOU -HOW TO TEACH YOURSELF- and UNLOCK your Golfing Brain.. ***. Ben was raised as an athlete in his hometown of Joliet, Illinois, by his father, and excelled as a football and baseball player for his high school and college Hall of Fame Coach, Gordie Gillespie.. In 1984, at the age of 26, after his Military Service was completed, Ben began his golf studies in Heidelberg, Germany. Then, in 1987, his teaching career began in Germany, where a majority of his students were Pure Beginners.. It was in this Golfing Infant Community that Ben began experimenting with a Consistent Method and credits that experience as his breakthrough in what would become The Mutz Method of Golf Instruction.. In Downtown Chicago, in the early 90s, he founded The Ben Mutz Golf Academy and received Tour Manufacture Credentials that helped launch one of the first Enlarged Putter Grips on the PGA Tour. He also hosted a TV show called Modern Golf with Ben Mutz.. Putt Two Par is the first in a series of four books that will cover Ben’s entire FOUNDATIONAL Method of Golf Instruction.**Ben’s Method Teaches Students How to Teach Themselves with the #1 Goal of UNLOCKING Their Golfing Brain!**

top_reviews.title: Eliminate the guesswork when putting!
top_reviews.body: This instructional book offers a quantitative, objective approach to what most golfers trust to “feel” …. distance control when putting. In it, Mr. Mutz describes how to set the length of the putting stroke based on pacing off the putt distance, producing a number which is then translated into a “body part to body part” stroke length. The number, and hence the stroke length, is increased/decreased to account for up/down slope changes along the length of the putt. He also offers a method for dealing with the left/right break of the putt by visualizing the point at which the putt will drop towards the hole and straight line-aiming at that target point. His method for producing the correct tempo is also discussed. The book ends with a series of drills to reinforce the method. I’ve been using Mr. Mutz’s putting method for several years now with a good deal of success (which, of course, is all relative in this game). While it sounds fairly complicated at first, after a while it becomes quite streamlined and second nature. As for the book itself, it reads as if Mr. Mutz is in front of you conducting training sessions. His enthusiasm and passion come through clearly and the many photos are quite useful. The book is a bit lengthy and there is a lot of repetition – all in hopes of driving home his method. I am an avid golfer generally shotting in the 90’s. But I average 2 putts per hole. When I stand over a putt, I feel confident that I can get it close – and confidence is quite important as we all know! In all, Mr. Mutz has much to offer golfers at every level.Read more

I’ve been using Mr. Mutz’s putting method for several years now with a good deal of success (which, of course, is all relative in this game). While it sounds fairly complicated at first, after a while it becomes quite streamlined and second nature. As for the book itself, it reads as if Mr. Mutz is in front of you conducting training sessions. His enthusiasm and passion come through clearly and the many photos are quite useful. The book is a bit lengthy and there is a lot of repetition – all in hopes of driving home his method. I am an avid golfer generally shotting in the 90’s. But I average 2 putts per hole. When I stand over a putt, I feel confident that I can get it close – and confidence is quite important as we all know! In all, Mr. Mutz has much to offer golfers at every level.

top_reviews.title: The Mutz method eliminates dependency on “feel and touch” and replaces it with “Simon Says”
top_reviews.body: Using one tempo for the putting stroke on a given course combined with the unique body-part-to-body-part method to control the pace of the putt is the secret to effective distance control. The author has cleverly developed a unique approach to distance control that will give the golfer the confidence to eliminate three-putting and lower his/her handicap. When you know that your aim and speed is correct, all your concentration can be focused on your putting stroke instead of your next putt. The instructions and illlustrations in this book make it easy to become a master putter and the drill section will allow you to hone your putting to perfection long after the read is over.Read more
top_reviews.body_html:
Using one tempo for the putting stroke on a given course combined with the unique body-part-to-body-part method to control the pace of the putt is the secret to effective distance control. The author has cleverly developed a unique approach to distance control that will give the golfer the confidence to eliminate three-putting and lower his/her handicap. When you know that your aim and speed is correct, all your concentration can be focused on your putting stroke instead of your next putt. The instructions and illlustrations in this book make it easy to become a master putter and the drill section will allow you to hone your putting to perfection long after the read is over.
Read more

top_reviews.title: 'Putt Two Par'  is a must for every golfer, instructor and coach!
top_reviews.body: Developing touch and feel for most golfers is extremely difficult and takes a lot of time. ‘Putt Two Par’ helps solve that problem!  The number one solution to better distance control, better speed and ultimately eliminating three putts is…knowing your distance. ‘Putt Two Par’ provides a simple logical system for players who don’t have the magical superpower called ‘touch’…it works.  Every Instructor and Coach should have a variety of techniques in their instructional arsenal to help all of your players! ‘Putt Two Par’ is a must!Read more
top_reviews.body_html:
Developing touch and feel for most golfers is extremely difficult and takes a lot of time. ‘Putt Two Par’ helps solve that problem!

The number one solution to better distance control, better speed and ultimately eliminating three putts is…knowing your distance. ‘Putt Two Par’ provides a simple logical system for players who don’t have the magical superpower called ‘touch’…it works.

Every Instructor and Coach should have a variety of techniques in their instructional arsenal to help all of your players! ‘Putt Two Par’ is a must!
Read more

date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2023

top_reviews.title: Easy read  Putting Improvement
top_reviews.body: My husband and I have taken many Putting lessons. My husband even went to a Putting school. Our main problem was that we would have too many 3 putts because we were terrible at distance control, so when I saw the Subtitle on Amazon- How to become a master at distance control while putting I was immediately interested and decided to give it shot. While we are not pros yet I can say we have seen improvement! I would highly recommend this easy read book!Read more
top_reviews.body_html:

profile.name: Great book. I recently posted 29 putts on my last round  Mutz takes the guess work out of putting. You can drop the ball anywhere on the green and I will get it down in 2 strokes or better!
